page.title: 06PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Wisbech St. Mary Parish Church The Church was built about 1385 and is Perpendicular Gothic in style. There is a 20th Century brass of Canon Mowbray Smith near the font. Across the road from the church is the Church House in which meetings are held. There are services in church every Sunday at 11am, usually Sung Eucharist but on the first Sunday in the month we have a Family Service. Sunday School meets in the village school at 11am and the children go up to church for the last 20 minutes of the service The bell-ringers practise in church from 7.30 till 9pm on Fridays. The bells are rung for half an hour before services and weddings. We have no vicar at the moment. Our last vicar was also Archdeacon of Wisbech. He left in August 1984 to become Dean of Ely. Our new vicar is coming in Sept.
